column5: 0 degrees celcius...(32*F)...ice making weather !!!  I hope you outdoor skating rink fans are happy...  As soon as Kelvin (Loonietunes) gets up we will be heading out on the lake...  Yesterday was too windy and rough to put his boat in but we managed to play with some panfish from shore in a protected bay...at least we got to wet a line...
Getting to be that time again Beans.  I actually called and booked my January Ice fishing trip on Nip last week.
Ok, it's 6:14pm...what happened???  did ya's get out on the water, catch anything...c'mon man we're waiting  Maureen
Hey Beans hope you did well today looking forward to the report  Better get the snowsuit on soon. LOL

Well  we went out around 9.30 am by the time we launched the boat... weather was not to bad for this time of year... Beans took me to a spot were we fished for a while.. caught a couple of bass then moved to another spot... nothing then went over to another spot.. lots for weeds... wind started to pick up so we went over to a sheltered bay and fished... went in to have brunch  then it was time for me to leave and head back to the Hammer  .  Thanks Norm and Marybeth for a great and Hospitable time  I really enjoyed myself even if we didn't get out in the boat Saturday.. at least we played around with the fish... Perch, bass, Rock Bass.... you are the new Champ Normmm..  Thanks again for the fun weekend.... we will do it again thats for sure  great meeting Meely also... Your spot is still safe Norm Blindfolded me on the way out again
Sorry that the weather wasn't better, but at least you managed to get out on the water for a bit.  Maureen
